snippet: The greater sage grouse might be declared an endangered species, restricting development of its habitat, leading the energy industry and the government to try to save the bird.
abstract: Federal wildlife officials are weighing putting greater sage grouse on endangered species list, move that will restrict development of its habitat and potentially disrupt energy production in those areas; potential designation has led energy industry and state officials, in unusual collaboration, to try to save the bird so that federal government will not step in; efforts highlight ongoing struggle to balance demand for energy against environmental priorities.

byline.original: By DIANE CARDWELL and CLIFFORD KRAUSS

lead_paragraph: The greater sage grouse might be declared an endangered species, restricting development of its habitat, leading the energy industry and the government to try to save the bird.

headline.main: Frack Quietly, Please: Sage Grouse Is Nesting
headline.print_headline: Frack Quietly, Please: Sage Grouse Is Nesting
